medical_history.chief_complaint: Severe arthropathy of the left, nondominant elbow.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Afibrinogenemia was diagnosed at birth. For many years, the patient was treated with human fibrinogen intravenously every two weeks. Over the years, the left elbow became increasingly symptomatic secondary to recurrent hemarthroses, with the elbow always being the primary joint involved. Symptoms plateaued until 2006, when the patient reported pain at rest, severe activity-related pain, and night pain, accompanied by difficulty in daily activities.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Congenital afibrinogenemia. Previous open elbow synovectomy at age 31.
medical_history.family_history: The causative mutation identified as a homozygous deletion of the fibrinogen alpha chain gene; affected family members include brother and two cousins.
medical_history.social_history: The patient is a telematics technician and able to work full time. Not specified if there are any other lifestyle factors.
